article_text: For the past 37 years a Cal Poly tradition has survived despite a lack of publicity —• a tradition rich with intensity and skill perfect for those who like to live life on the edge. This tradition, the Hi-Mountain Enduro race, began in 1950 and is an annual event organized by the Cal Poly Penguins Motorcycle Club. March 29, the Enduro race went off without a hitch with more than 4(X) riders participating in the event. “This is the most challenging event we put on,’’ said Poly Penguins President Kevin Lalor. “It is very intense and demanding Do Soviet and American governments purposefully cloud communications between their countries and citizens, creating mistrust and misconceptions? See INSIGHT, page 5.
